intro: Hybanthus leucopogon, commonly known as the white-headed hybanthus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its small, white flowers with prominent yellow stamens. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, often found in moist, open habitats. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with fine hairs. The fruit is a capsule that releases small, wind-dispersed seeds.
